TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit CultureAndRegionInfoBuilder extends System.Object

summary.span: 定义一个新型或基于其他区域性和国家/地区的自定义区域性。

span.span: Defines a custom culture that is new or based on another culture and country/region.

summary.span: 自定义区域性可以安装在计算机上，然后由运行在该计算机上的任何应用程序使用。

span.span: The custom culture can be installed on a computer and subsequently used by any application that is running on that computer.

summary.span: 此类不能被继承。

span.span: This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 类包含特定于区域性的信息，例如相关的语言、 子语言、 国家/地区、 日历和区域性约定。The class holds culture-specific information, such as the associated language, sublanguage, country/region, calendar, and cultural conventions. 此类还提供的特定于区域性的实例， ， ，和类的大小写、 格式设置和分析日期和数字等特定于区域性的操作所必需的和比较字符串。This class also provides culture-specific instances of the , , , and classes, which are required for culture-specific operations such as casing, formatting and parsing dates and numbers, and comparing strings. 默认情况下，.NET Framework 支持代表一组预定义的区域性的对象。By default, the .NET Framework supports objects that represent a predefined set of cultures. 一种区域性的列表，请参阅[国家/地区语言支持 (NLS) API 参考](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=200048)在访问全球开发人员中心。For a list of these cultures, see the [National Language Support (NLS) API Reference](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=200048) at the Go Global Developer Center. 类，可创建一个自定义区域性，是一个全新或重写预定义的区域性。The class enables you to create a custom culture that is completely new or that overrides a predefined culture. 当自定义区域性是安装并注册在特定计算机上时，它将成为无法区分从预定义对象，，和可以实例化并使用这些对象相似。When a custom culture is installed and registered on a particular computer, it becomes indistinguishable from predefined objects, and can be instantiated and used just like those objects. > [!IMPORTANT] > 请注意，类位于名为 sysglobl.dll 程序集。Note that the class is found in an assembly named sysglobl.dll. 已成功编译使用此类型的代码需要添加对 sysglobl.dll 的引用。Successfully compiling code that uses this type requires that you add a reference to sysglobl.dll. 只能由该计算机上具有管理权限的用户，可以在计算机上注册一个自定义区域性。A custom culture can be registered on a computer only by a user who has administrative rights on that computer. 因此，应用通常未创建和安装自定义区域性。Consequently, apps typically do not create and install custom cultures. 相反，可以使用类，以创建一个专用的工具，管理员可用于创建、 安装和注册自定义区域性。Instead, you can use the class to create a special-purpose tool that an administrator can use to create, install, and register a custom culture. 在一台计算机上注册的自定义区域性后，可以使用应用创建自定义区域性的实例，就像为预定义区域性中的类。After the custom culture is registered on a computer, you can use the class in your app to create instances of the custom culture just as you would for a predefined culture. 如果您要分析生成的自定义区域性的日期和时间字符串，应使用或方法而不是或方法以提高分析操作成功的可能性。If you parse date and time strings generated for a custom culture, you should use the or method instead of the or method to improve the probability that the parse operation will succeed. 自定义区域性的日期和时间字符串可以是复杂，因此难以分析。A date and time string for a custom culture can be complicated and therefore difficult to parse. 和方法尝试分析具有多个隐式分析模式，所有这些可能会失败的字符串。The and methods try to parse a string with several implicit parse patterns, all of which might fail. 方法，与此相反，需要应用程序显式指定一个或多个可能会成功的确切的分析模式。The method, in contrast, requires the application to explicitly designate one or more exact parse patterns that are likely to succeed. ## 定义和创建自定义区域性Defining and Creating a Custom Culture 您使用类来定义和命名自定义区域性。You use the class to define and name a custom culture. 自定义区域性可以是全新的区域性、 新区域性，基于现有的区域性 （即，附加区域性） 或替换现有的.NET Framework 区域性的区域性。The custom culture can be an entirely new culture, a new culture that is based on an existing culture (that is, a supplemental culture), or a culture that replaces an existing .NET Framework culture. 每种情况下，基本步骤是相同的：In each case, the basic steps are the same: 1. 实例化对象通过调用其构造函数。Instantiate a object by calling its constructor. 若要替换现有的区域性，请将传递该区域性的名称和到构造函数的枚举值。To replace an existing culture, pass that culture's name and the enumeration value to the constructor. 若要创建新的区域性或补充区域性，请将传递唯一的区域性名称，并或枚举值。To create a new culture or a supplemental culture, pass a unique culture name and either the or enumeration value. > [!NOTE] > 如果您使用枚举值来实例化对象，对象的属性中的值自动填充要替换的对象。If you use the enumeration value to instantiate a object, the object's properties are automatically populated with values from the object to be replaced. 2. 如果要创建新的或补充区域性：If you are creating a new or supplemental culture: - 填充对象的属性通过调用方法并传入其属性值是类似于你的新对象的对象。Populate the object's properties by calling the method and passing a object whose property values are similar to your new object. - 填充对象的区域属性通过调用方法并传入对象，表示自定义区域性的区域。Populate the object's regional properties by calling the method and passing a object that represents the region of your custom culture. 3. 修改的属性对象根据需要。Modify the properties of the object as necessary. 4. 如果想要在一个单独的例程中注册的自定义区域性，调用方法。If you are planning to register the custom culture in a separate routine, call the method. 这会生成可以加载和注册单独的自定义区域性的安装例程中的 XML 文件。This generates an XML file that you can load and register in a separate custom culture installation routine. ## 注册自定义区域性Registering a Custom Culture 如果你正在开发一个自定义区域性，它独立于应用程序的注册应用程序创建区域性，则调用方法来加载 XML 文件包含自定义区域性的定义并实例化对象。If you are developing a registration application for a custom culture that is separate from the application that creates the culture, you call the method to load the XML file that contains the custom culture's definition and instantiate the object. 若要处理注册，调用方法。To handle the registration, call the method. 对于成功的注册，注册的自定义区域性的应用程序必须运行具有管理权限;，目标系统上否则为在调用引发异常。For the registration to succeed, the application that registers the custom culture must be running with administrative privileges on the target system; otherwise, the call to throws an exception. > [!WARNING] > 区域性数据可能不同系统之间。Culture data can differ between systems. 如果使用的类，以创建一个跨多个系统，和是统一的自定义区域性通过从现有加载数据创建自定义区域性和对象和自定义它，你应该开发两个不同的实用程序。If you are using the class to create a custom culture that is uniform across multiple systems and you are creating your custom culture by loading data from existing and objects and customizing it, you should develop two different utilities. 第一个创建自定义区域性，并将其保存到 XML 文件。The first creates the custom culture and saves it to an XML file. 第二个使用方法从 XML 文件加载的自定义区域性并将其注册目标计算机上。The second uses the method to load the custom culture from an XML file and register it on the target computer. 注册过程将执行以下任务：The registration process performs the following tasks: - 创建一个包含在中定义的信息的.nlp 文件对象。Creates an .nlp file that contains the information that is defined in the object. - 将.nlp 文件存储在目标计算机上的 %windir%\Globalization 系统目录。Stores the .nlp file in the %windir%\Globalization system directory on the target computer. 这使自定义区域性设置的会话之间保持不变。This enables the custom culture's settings to persist between sessions. (方法需要管理权限，因为.nlp 文件存储在系统目录中。)(The method requires administrative privileges because the .nlp file is stored in a system directory.) - 准备没有创建新的自定义区域性的请求的.NET Framework 下一次而不是内部缓存 %windir%\Globalization 系统目录中搜索。Prepares the .NET Framework to search the %windir%\Globalization system directory instead of an internal cache the next time there is a request to create your new custom culture. 已成功注册自定义区域性时，是无法区分从预定义的.NET Framework 的区域性。When a custom culture is successfully registered, it is indistinguishable from the cultures that are predefined by the .NET Framework. 自定义区域性的有效期截至调用方法从本地计算机上移除.nlp 文件。The custom culture is available until a call to the method removes the .nlp file from the local computer. ## 实例化一个自定义区域性Instantiating a Custom Culture 可以通过以下方式之一创建自定义区域性的实例：You can create an instance of the custom culture in one of the following ways: - 通过调用具有区域性名称的构造函数。By invoking the constructor with the culture name. - 通过调用具有区域性名称的方法。By calling the method with the culture name. - 通过调用具有区域性名称的方法。By calling the method with the culture name. 此外，数组返回的对象方法包含自定义区域性。In addition, the array of objects that is returned by the method includes the custom culture. ## Examples 下面的示例定义一个自定义的 ru 美国区域性表示在美国的俄语语言。The following example defines a custom ru-US culture that represents the Russian language in the United States. 该示例通过从俄语 （俄罗斯） 加载设置来定义自定义区域性对象和美国对象，然后再设置大量属性。The example defines the custom culture by loading settings from the Russian (Russia) object and the U.S. object, and then sets a number of properties. 示例注册自定义区域性，然后将其实例，并使其当前线程区域性内容。The example registers the custom culture, and then instantiates it and makes it the current thread culture. span.span: The name of a culture.

param.span: 一个 值，指定新的 对象是非特定区域性、新区域性，还是要替换现有的区域性和国家/地区。

span.span: One of the values that specifies whether the new object is a neutral culture, replaces an existing culture and country/region, or is a new culture.

summary.span: 初始化 类的新实例。

span.span: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `cultureName`参数指定的新名称对象。The `cultureName` parameter specifies the name of the new object. `flags`参数用于值，该值指定是否新对象是一个新的自定义区域性，或替换现有的非特定区域性、 特定区域性或 Windows 区域设置。The `flags` parameter is used for a value that specifies whether the new object is a new custom culture, or replaces an existing neutral culture, specific culture, or Windows locale. 如果`cultureName`参数指定一个现有的.NET Framework 区域性、 已注册自定义区域性或从 Windows 区域设置，生成的区域性构造函数会自动填充新与区域性的对象和国家/地区的信息。If the `cultureName` parameter specifies an existing .NET Framework culture, registered custom culture, or culture generated from a Windows locale, the constructor automatically populates the new object with culture and country/region information. 填充新通过调用对象的区域性和国家/地区信息和方法。Populate the new object with culture and country/region information by invoking the and methods. ## 自定义区域性名称Custom Culture Names 首选的格式`cultureName`参数为新的自定义区域性是"[`prefix`-]`language`[-`region`] [-`suffix`[`…`]]"，其中`language`是必需的组件和`prefix`，`region`，和`suffix`组件是可选的。The preferred format of the `cultureName` parameter for a new, custom culture is "[`prefix`-]`language`[-`region`][-`suffix`[`…`]]", where the `language` component is required and the `prefix`, `region`, and `suffix` components are optional. 每个组件的最大长度是 8 个字符和整个的最大长度`cultureName`参数是 84 个字符。The maximum length of each component is 8 characters and the maximum length of the entire `cultureName` parameter is 84 characters. `prefix`组件是 Internet 分配号机构 (IANA) 标识。The `prefix` component is the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA) identification. 指定"i-"或"我的"为注册 IANA，或"x-"或"X-"的区域性名称保留供专用的区域性名称。Specify "i-" or "I-" for culture names registered with the IANA, or "x-" or "X-" for culture names reserved for private use. 否则，该前缀不是必需的。Otherwise, the prefix is not required. 有关详细信息，请参阅 RFC 4646，"标记的标识的语言。"For more information, see RFC 4646, "Tags for the Identification of Languages." `language`组成部分`cultureName`参数指定派生自 ISO 639-1 的小写双字母代码和`region`指定派生自 ISO 3166 的大写双字母代码。The `language` component of the `cultureName` parameter specifies a lowercase two-letter code derived from ISO 639-1, and `region` specifies an uppercase two-letter code derived from ISO 3166. 例如，EN-US 代表读出在美国英语。For example, en-US stands for English as spoken in the United States. 如果没有`region`组件表示非特定区域性。The absence of the `region` component signifies a neutral culture. 一个`cultureName`，它是相同的.NET Framework 附带的区域性名称表示一个替换 （覆盖） 区域性。A `cultureName` that is the same as the name of a culture included with the .NET Framework signifies a replacement (override) culture. 可以分配给一个替换区域性的属性的值是有限的。The values that can be assigned to the properties of a replacement culture are limited. 有关此类限制的详细信息，请参阅每个属性的例外情况。For more information about such limitations, see the exceptions for each property. 应用程序使用`suffix`组件以区分相似的区域性。The application uses the `suffix` component to distinguish similar cultures. 例如，两家公司，ABC 和 XYZ，创建并共享新的 ASP.NET Web 服务来提升其产品在世界各地的不同市场。For example, two companies, ABC and XYZ, create and share a new ASP.NET Web service to promote their products in different markets around the world. 服务网页显示区域的徽标和具体取决于用户的区域性的每个公司的本地电话号码等信息。The Web pages for the service display information such as the regional logo and local telephone number of each company depending on the user's culture. 每个网页的区域性特定内容是在单独的资源文件中由区域性名称标识，并且由公司名称限定。The culture-specific content for each Web page is in separate resource files identified by culture name and qualified by company name. 例如，EN-US 和 JA-JP 区域性的资源文件是名为 en 美国 ABC、 en 美国 XYZ、 日本 JP ABC 和日本 JP XYZ。For example, resource files for the en-US and ja-JP cultures are named en-US-ABC, en-US-XYZ, ja-JP-ABC, and ja-JP-XYZ. "ABC"和"XYZ"后缀启用 Web 服务以使用相同的应用程序逻辑来显示不同的特定于市场的信息。The "ABC" and "XYZ" suffixes enable the Web service to use the same application logic to display different market-specific information. `suffix`组件可以包含子部分，其中每个子组件由连字符分隔，每个子组件的最大长度是 8 个字符。The `suffix` component can consist of subcomponents, where each subcomponent is delimited by a hyphen and the maximum length of each subcomponent is 8 characters. 例如，如果"英语-美国-honda-汽车"为`cultureName`参数，"-honda-汽车"为`suffix`组件。For example, if "en-US-honda-cars" is the `cultureName` parameter, "-honda-cars" is the `suffix` component. ## Examples 下面的代码示例使用一个专用的前缀，创建一个自定义区域性，则列出了一组其属性。The following code example creates a custom culture with a private use prefix, then lists a set of its properties. 第一个属性列表的区域性名称。The first property lists the name of the culture. [!code-cpp[sys.glob.carib1#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/sys.glob.carib1/CPP/carib.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[sys.glob.carib1#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/sys.glob.carib1/CS/carib.cs#1)] [!code-vb[sys.glob.carib1#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/sys.glob.carib1/VB/carib.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在 get 操作中，属性对应于方法。In a get operation, the property corresponds to the method. 指定`null`在设置操作中以指示由当前定义的区域性对象是可选的用户界面区域性。Specify `null` in a set operation to indicate that the culture defined by the current object is the alternate user interface culture. 如果尝试将属性设置为自身具有不同的控制台回退用户界面区域性的区域性，则它将指定的最后一个"叶"区域性。If you attempt to set the property to a culture that itself has a different Console Fallback UI Culture, then it will be assigned that final "leaf" culture. 阿拉伯语、 希伯来语、 波斯语、 乌尔都语和叙利亚语等语言为基础的双向文本。Languages such as Arabic, Hebrew, Persian, Urdu and Syriac are based on bi-directional text. Windows 应用程序，使用图形用户界面，支持双向语言。Windows applications, which employ a graphical user interface, support bi-directional languages. 但是，控制台应用程序，采用操作系统控制台的文本用户界面，不提供的双向支持。However, console applications, which employ the text user interface of the operating system console, do not provide bi-directional support. 因此，如果一个控制台应用程序本地化为阿拉伯语或希伯来语，则控制台屏幕上显示不可读的文本。Consequently, if a console application is localized to Arabic or Hebrew, it displays unreadable text on the console screen. 用户界面区域性指定应用程序需要支持用户输入和输出，并且默认情况下是与操作系统的系统区域性相同的资源。The user interface culture specifies the resources that an application needs to support user input and output, and by default is the same as the operating system culture. 例如，属性返回的阿拉伯语区域性为阿拉伯语操作系统。For example, the property returns an Arabic culture for an Arabic operating system. 应用程序应使用属性来检索适合控制台应用程序用户界面的非特定区域性。The application should use the property to retrieve a neutral culture suitable for a console application user interface.

XML 文件的格式称为区域设置数据标记语言 (LDML) 版本 1.1。The format of the XML file is called Locale Data Markup Language (LDML) version 1.1. 一个新对象创建和使用中的数据初始化`xmlFileName`。A new object is created and initialized with the data in `xmlFileName`. 方法执行的反向操作方法。The method performs the reverse operation of the method. LDML 文件中的区域性属性指定的子元素``中的元素``部分。In the LDML file, the properties of a culture are specified as child elements of the `` element in the `` section. 属性值通常由元素的指定`type`属性。A property value is typically specified by the element's `type` attribute. 例如，以下内容摘自 LDML 文件定义为英语的非特定区域性的区域性的父。For example, the following excerpt from an LDML file defines a culture's parent as the English neutral culture. ```xml ldml version 1.1 ``` 有关 LDML 标准的详细信息，请参阅[Unicode 技术标准 #35、"区域设置数据标记语言 (LDML)"](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=252840) Unicode Consortium 网站上。For more information about the LDML standard, see [Unicode Technical Standard #35, "Locale Data Markup Language (LDML)"](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=252840) on the Unicode Consortium website. ## Examples 下面的示例演示和方法。The following example demonstrates the and methods. summary.span: 获取或设置根据 RFC 4646 标准“Tags for the Identification of Languages”（语言标识标记）进行格式化的区域性名称。

span.span: Gets or sets a culture name formatted according to the RFC 4646 standard, "Tags for the Identification of Languages."

value.span: 根据 RFC 4646 格式化的区域性名称。

span.span: A culture name formatted according to RFC 4646.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性获取或设置根据 RFC 4646，后者可以不同于返回的区域性名称进行格式化的区域性名称属性。The property gets or sets a culture name formatted according to RFC 4646, which can be different from the culture name returned by the property. 例如，在.NET Framework 1.0 版中，对于繁体中文的非特定区域性名称为"ZH-CHT"。For example, in the .NET Framework version 1.0, the neutral culture name for Traditional Chinese was "zh-CHT". 与此相反，RFC 4646 定义该区域性名称为"ZH-HANT"。In contrast, RFC 4646 defines that culture name as "zh-HANT". （请注意，在.NET Framework 版本 4 中，"ZH-CHT"显示名称是"中文 （繁体） 旧"）。(Note that in the .NET Framework version 4, the Display Name for "zh-CHT" is "Chinese (Traditional) Legacy".) RFC 4646 区域性名称包括几个组件。An RFC 4646 culture name consists of several components. 典型的区域性名称包含必需的语言标识符、 可选脚本标识符和可选的国家/地区标识符。A typical culture name consists of a mandatory language identifier, an optional script identifier, and an optional country/region identifier. 例如，塞尔维亚语、 西里尔语脚本和塞尔维亚共和国的区域的有效 RFC 4646 区域性名称是"sr 符号 RS"。For example, a valid RFC 4646 culture name for the Serbian language, the Cyrillic script, and the region of Serbia is "sr-Cyrl-RS". 请注意两个或多个区域性可以使用同一个 IETF 语言标记。Note that two or more cultures can have the same IETF language tag. 详细信息，请参阅 RFC 4646，"标记为标识的语言，"网址[征求意见](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=45286)。For more information, see RFC 4646, "Tags for the Identification of Languages," at [Request For Comments](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=45286).

summary.span: 获取或设置表示当前自定义区域性的父区域性的 对象。

span.span: Gets or sets the object that represents the parent culture of the current custom culture.

value.span: 表示当前自定义区域性的父区域性的 对象。

span.span: The object that represents the parent culture of the current custom culture.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 区域性具有层次结构。The cultures have a hierarchy. 对于预定义区域性，特定区域性的父级是一个非特定区域性和非特定区域性的父级是。For predefined cultures, the parent of a specific culture is a neutral culture and the parent of a neutral culture is the . 父区域性包含仅的信息所共有及其子级集。The parent culture encompasses only the set of information that is common among its children. 通常建议自定义区域性符合此层次结构。It is generally recommended that custom cultures conform to this hierarchy. 但是，默认情况下，的自定义区域性是所基于的区域性。However, by default, the of a custom culture is the of the culture on which it is based. 如果应用程序会创建具有区域性"en 美国 MyCulture"基于"EN-US"，请在其父级为"en"，因为这是的"EN-US"。If the application creates a culture with "en-US-MyCulture" based on "en-US", its parent is "en" because that is the of "en-US". 如果应用程序使用"EN-US"作为的新的自定义区域性，它必须显式设置此值。If the application uses "en-US" as the of the new custom culture, it must set this value explicitly. 如果为特定区域性资源不可用在系统中，使用非特定区域性的资源。If the resources for the specific culture are not available in the system, the resources for the neutral culture are used. 如果非特定区域性资源不可用，则使用嵌入在主程序集中的资源。If the resources for the neutral culture are not available, the resources embedded in the main assembly are used. 资源回退进程有关的详细信息，请参阅[打包和部署资源](~/docs/framework/resources/packaging-and-deploying-resources-in-desktop-apps.md)。For more information about the resource fallback process, see [Packaging and Deploying Resources](~/docs/framework/resources/packaging-and-deploying-resources-in-desktop-apps.md). Windows API 中的区域性的列表是略有不同的.NET Framework 中的区域性列表。The list of cultures in the Windows API is slightly different from the list of cultures in the .NET Framework. 如果与 Windows 互操作性是必需的例如，通过平台调用机制，该应用程序应使用.NET Framework 中定义的特定区域性。If interoperability with Windows is required, for example, through the platform invoke mechanism, the application should use a specific culture that is defined in the .NET Framework. 这可确保与等效的 Windows 区域设置，具有相同标识的一致性。This ensures consistency with the equivalent Windows locale, which is identified with the same .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法将返回由 Win32 的目录的全球化子目录中的本地计算机上的文件作为存储自定义区域性[GetWindowsDirectory](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=191561)函数。The method stores a custom culture as a file on the local computer, in the Globalization subdirectory of the directory returned by the Win32 [GetWindowsDirectory](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=191561) function. 此过程称为注册自定义区域性。This process is called registering the custom culture. 注册自定义区域性后，可以通过指定的区域性名称创建一个新的自定义区域性构造函数或调用时方法。After the custom culture is registered, a new custom culture can be created by specifying the culture name in a constructor or when calling the method. 可通过调用来删除自定义区域性方法。The custom culture can be removed by calling the method. ## Examples 下面的示例演示方法。The following example demonstrates the method. Public Shared Sub Unregister (cultureName As String)

param.name: cultureName
param.span: 要删除的自定义文化的名称。

span.span: The name of the custom culture to delete.

summary.span: 从本地计算机中删除自定义区域性。

span.span: Deletes a custom culture from the local computer.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法执行的相反方法。The method does the reverse of the method. 方法将存储为 Win32 API 返回的目录的全球化子目录中的本地计算机上的文件在一个自定义区域性[GetWindowsDirectory](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=191561)函数。The method stores a custom culture as a file on the local computer, in the Globalization subdirectory of the directory returned by the Win32 API [GetWindowsDirectory](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=191561) function. 方法从计算机中删除持久化的自定义区域性文件。The method deletes the persisted custom culture file from the computer. 将删除该文件后，在计算机内存中的自定义区域性的现有实例继续运行，但不能创建自定义区域性的新实例。After the file is deleted, existing instances of the custom culture in computer memory continue to work, but new instances of the custom culture cannot be created. ## Examples 下面的示例演示方法。The following example demonstrates the method.
